cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 255 miles SSE of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn WNW toward the Yucatán Channel late Monday, then accelerate north-northwestward across the southern Gulf of Mexico and toward the northern Gulf Coast mid-week.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: U.S. northern Gulf Coast (likely Louisiana–Mississippi coast)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch for Pinar del Rio province, western Cuba
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Yucatán Peninsula, western Cuba, and the northern Gulf Coast from Louisiana eastward to the Alabama–Florida border
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions (20–30 mph) possible late Thursday into Friday as the remnant low passes inland to the west.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at Wilmington, DE because the system remains well inland when it passes.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of rain possible late Thursday–Friday; localized minor ponding on terminal surfaces.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief river current increase on the Delaware River from upstream rainfall, but no significant navigation restriction anticipated.
